name.value: Chest Pain (CP) / Coronary Artery Disease (CAD) Documentation Template

title.value: Chest Pain (CP) / Coronary Artery Disease (CAD) Documentation Template

display.value: Adult with stable chest pain being considered for cardiology consultation (excluding unstable symptoms and acute coronary syndromes)
Provider in a Primary Care Clinic

description.value: This documentation template is not applicable for unstable patients

This documentation template is not applicable for use with patients who are unstable based on clinician judgement. Examples of unstable patients include, but are not limited to, patients with chest pain pattern suggestive of ACS (e.g., those with new onset resting CP, CP with minimal exertion, new unstable angina pattern, ST-segment elevation, non–ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction on ECG, or suspected aortic dissection), and patients with any of the following symptoms or findings:

display.value: This documentation template is not applicable for use with patients who are unstable based on clinician judgement. Examples of unstable patients include, but are not limited to, patients with chest pain pattern suggestive of ACS (e.g., those with new onset resting CP, CP with minimal exertion, new unstable angina pattern, ST-segment elevation, non–ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction on ECG, or suspected aortic dissection), and patients with any of the following symptoms or findings:

description.value: Provide a link to the American Heart Association Risk Calculator

display.value: Provide a link to the American Heart Association Risk Calculator

description.value: Each item in this section needs to include an expression, and a model (phenomenon testing result, thyroid result testing function measurement date within an interval of now to two years ago

Images and diagnostic studies older than one year are not considered for inclusion in this documentation template. For this documentation template, the following information should be included, if available from the prior 1 year. Image and result text should be attached automatically if they are is provided for the 12-Lead Electrocardiogram Interpretation field.
